conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have height and thickness, interior volumes are visible from an angled/isometric viewpoint, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose rooms.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion with readable wall thickness, good room volume, and a clean cutaway. Minor softness in corner crispness and some perspective/DOF stylization but still geometrically legible.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall footprint and major zoning (left bedroom, central bath/core, living in lower middle, kitchen/dining on right, master bedroom upper/right zone) largely match. However, the small top-center/right office/study from the 2D plan appears merged into/represented within the bedroom zone rather than as a clearly separate room, and some internal partition/door relationships look simplified.

interior_elements.notes: Living room, kitchen/dining, and bathroom fixtures are present. Bedroom furniture exists but the left bedroom shows one bed rather than the two single beds shown in the 2D plan; the dedicated office furniture/room is not clearly separated as in the plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are distinguishable and the cutaway is clean. Lighting is adequate and geometry is readable. Presentation is clean with no UI/text overlays; minor depth-of-field/softness slightly reduces precision readability.

detected_errors.description: Top-center/right small office/study in the 2D plan is not clearly preserved as a distinct room in the 3D layout (appears merged/simplified into adjacent bedroom/core area).
Left bedroom furniture count differs: 2D shows two single beds; 3D depicts a single bed arrangement.
Some door/opening placements and partition details appear simplified relative to the 2D plan, reducing one-to-one fidelity.

summary: A genuine and well-executed cutaway 3D conversion with strong overall layout matching, but with notable simplification/merging of the small office area and some door/furniture mismatches versus the 2D plan.
